alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 3:58AM MST until January 08 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches below 7500 feet, 6 to 12 inches above 7500 feet with locally higher amounts of up to 18 inches near the Colorado border. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Far Northwest Highlands, Jemez Mountains, Northwest Highlands, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, Chuska Mountains, Northwest Plateau, West Central Mountains, and West Central Plateau. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Check road conditions before heading out. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected during the day Sunday into Sunday night. Areas of blowing snow are possible during this period.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
